snippet: North Dakota’s top energy regulator proposed that oil companies be required to reduce the volatility of crude before it is shipped by rail.
abstract: North Dakota Industrial Commission unveils new rules that will require oil companies to reduce volatility of crude before it ships by rail; oil trains in United States and Canada were involved in at least 10 major accidents in last 18 months.
lead_paragraph: North Dakota’s top energy regulator proposed that oil companies be required to reduce the volatility of crude before it is shipped by rail.

headline.main: Rule Sought on Shipping Oil by Train
headline.print_headline: Rule Sought on Shipping Oil by Train
